tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
This psalm is a prayer for help.
"This is for the director of music to use in worship"
Possible meanings are 1) David wrote the psalm or 2) the psalm is about David or 3) the psalm is in the style of David's psalms.
"save"

tn.ref: Hide me from the secret plotting ... commotion of the doers of iniquity
tn.text: These two clauses have similar meanings. The second clause provides more detail by describing what the "secret plotting" sounds like. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Here the implied words "hide me" can be added to the translation. AT: "hide me from the commotion" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
a confusing sound of noise and excitement

tn.ref: They have sharpened their tongues like swords
tn.text: The writer speaks of his enemies' tongues as if they were as sharp as swords. Here "tongues" represents the harsh words that the enemies speak. AT: "The harsh things that they say hurt me like a sharp sword" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The writer speaks of his enemies' bitter words as if they were arrows being shot at him. AT: "bitter words which pierce me like arrows" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The evildoers do not expect an answer to their question because they think no one will see them. AT: "No one will see what we are doing" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: The inner thoughts and hearts of man are deep
tn.text: The writer speaks of man's "inner thoughts" and "hearts of man" as if they were a deep body of water that no one can explore all the way to the bottom. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Both of these phrases refer to man's private or inner thoughts. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
The writer continues to speak of the "evildoers" of [[:en:bible:notes:psa:064:001|64:01]].

tn.ref: But God will shoot them ... with his arrows
tn.text: The writer speaks of God's punishment of the evildoers as if God were shooting arrows at them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: They will be made to stumble
tn.text: The writer speaks of God's causing the evildoers' plans to fail as if God were making them stumble in their paths. This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will make them stumble" or "God will cause their plans to fail" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: since their own tongues are against them
tn.text: Here "tongues" represents the words that they say. AT: "since the words that they say are against them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"what God has done"
Going to Yahweh for protection is spoken of as taking refuge in him. AT: "go to him for protection" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: all the upright in heart will take pride in him
tn.text: Here "upright in heart" is an idiom that means godly or righteous. AT: "all the people who are godly will praise him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
